data.description:
The sequel to the popular Cueist pool/snooker game, Cueist 2 brings unparalelled realism to online VR cue sports. This is not a casual point and click type game, but a deeper simulation which will reward real skill.

 - Play online against your friends with voice chat and Meta Avatars or get some practice in versus the CPU players.
 - Use a natural cueing action using the Touch Controllers, or attach a real cue for the ultimate in feel and accuracy.
 - A choice of specialist cues enables various spin, swerve, masse, and jump shots.
 - Choose between 9 Ball, 8 Ball, UK 8 Ball, and Snooker.

The latest update adds:
 - Click the left thumbstick to switch between smooth movement and stepped movement (for those who might find smooth movement unsettling)
 - Click the right thumbstick to switch between smooth rotation and snap turns.
 - A new laser aim pointer to aid lining up shots
 - When the shot is lined up, you can nowhold the Y button on the left controller to enable Autoplay

changelog.change_log:
- You can now choose between 8 types of table physics; some serious, some silly
- Adjusted the CPU difficulty curve to help beginners
- Various minor bugfixes

The latest update adds:
 - Click the left thumbstick to switch between smooth movement and stepped movement (for those who might find smooth movement unsettling)
 - Click the right thumbstick to switch between smooth rotation and snap turns.
 - A new laser aim pointer to aid lining up shots
 - When the shot is lined up, you can now choose to hold the Y button on the left controller to enable Autoplay. Release the Y button to play the shot with the desired power (for those who are unable to use the standard cueing action effectively)
 - Now defaults to use the Novice Cue with minimal spin, to give beginners better shot accuracy.

The latest update adds:
 - Click the left thumbstick to switch between smooth movement and stepped movement (for those who might find smooth movement unsettling)
 - Click the right thumbstick to switch between smooth rotation and snap turns.
 - A new laser aim pointer to aid lining up shots
 - When the shot is lined up and the laser pointer showing, you can now choose to hold the Y button on the left controller to enable Autoplay. Release the Y button to play the shot with the desired power (for those who are unable to use the standard cueing action effectively)
 - Now defaults to use the Novice Cue with minimal spin, to give beginners better shot accuracy.

- Enabled users to hit any ball at any time, not just when it's their turn. This will cause a foul of course, so be careful!
- Automatically starts a new match with the same settings after a match is won.

- Added Meta Avatar 2 for local and remote players
- Various UI and network improvements
